title: Noun Morphology Simplification
body: The <alman /> dialect systematically eliminates grammatical gender distinctions and case-based noun inflections through morphological regularization. Nouns maintain a single invariant form across nominative, accusative, and dative cases, with genitive constructions employing a distinct analytical marker. Plural forms preserve their standard nominative/accusative morphology across all syntactic contexts.

rules.title: Case Ending Elimination
rules.description:
All case-specific noun endings are removed, including:
- Genitive -s/-es markers (des Mannes → der Mann)
- Dative plural -n suffixes (den Bränden → die Brände)
- Weak noun declensional patterns

rules.title: Invariant Plural Forms
rules.description: Standard nominative/accusative plural forms serve as universal plural markers, remaining unchanged in dative and genitive contexts. This preserves recognizable plural morphology while eliminating case-based modifications.
